```{r libraries, warning=FALSE, message=FALSE}

library(dplyr)

```

```{r knitr_setup, include=FALSE}

```

In order to include Chinese grade levels, this data is supplemented with [grade-level
specific lists of ideographs](https://cd.jiajiaoban.com/e/20210314/604de778686f4.shtml){target="rnacosupplement"}.

```{r xiaoxuewenzi}
wenzi <- list(list( grade = 1, chars = grade1str),
            list( grade = 2, chars = grade2str),
            list( grade = 3, chars = grade3str),
            list( grade = 4, chars = grade4str),
            list( grade = 5, chars = grade5str),
            list( grade = 6, chars = grade6str))

df <- lapply(wenzi, function(v) {
	index <- as.integer(v$grade)
	char <- unlist(stringi::stri_split_boundaries(v$chars, type='character'))
	zhGrade <- as.integer(c(rep(index ,stri_length(v$chars))))
	tibble(char, zhGrade)
})

zhXiaoxueWenzi <- dplyr::bind_rows(df)
zhXiaoxueWenzi <- zhXiaoxueWenzi %>%
	mutate(ucsstr = stringi::stri_trans_general(char,"Any-Hex/Unicode"),
		ucs = as.hexmode(stringi::stri_replace_all_fixed(ucsstr,"U+","")) ) %>%
	select(ucs , char, zhGrade)
zhXiaoxueWenzi
```

## Data cleaning

In later usage, it was found that the ideograph 介 is present in both 2nd and 5th grade sets.
The following code revealed 368 ideographs present multiple times.

```
zhXiaoxueWenzi %>% # select(ucs, char) %>% 
	group_by(ucs,char) %>%
	mutate(n = n()) %>%
	ungroup() %>%
	filter(n > 1)
```

So clean up. Keep the lowest grade level only.

```{r cleanup}
zhXiaoxueWenzi <- zhXiaoxueWenzi %>% # select(ucs, char) %>% 
	group_by(ucs,char) %>%
	mutate(n = n()) %>%
	ungroup() %>%
	group_by(ucs,char,n) %>%
	mutate(mingrade = min(zhGrade)) %>%
	ungroup() %>%
	filter(zhGrade == mingrade) %>%
	select(ucs,char,zhGrade)
zhXiaoxueWenzi
```

Check again.

```{r recheck}
zhXiaoxueWenzi %>% # select(ucs, char) %>% 
	group_by(ucs,char) %>%
	mutate(n = n()) %>%
	ungroup() %>%
	filter(n > 1)
```
